subject: frosting in all its forms
body:
1\. frosted mini wheats cereal. as with poptarts, can't imagine ever wanting the unfrosted version (thankful for frosting in all its forms). ran out of blueberries to put on top after, at the grocery store on sunday, contemplating buying a second container of blueberries, which were on a good sale, but decided not to out of a desire to not get "too much"—thankful to learn from this lesson and next time buy a second container.

2\. miso woke us up in the night because there was a spider on deborah's pillow, which miso did not kill but i (once i had become sufficiently awake) did kill. the brief period when miso is frisky and playful in the morning after having her breakfast and going outside. when her paws are wet from the morning dew in the grass and deborah calls her a "dandy dew girl"

3\. at 9 there is a meeting to brief me on a new project i'm starting on next week and of course the standard "does this need to be a meeting" feelings apply but also in another way makes me feel special that a lot of talented people i work with will gather together with the sole purpose of teaching me things.
normalized_markdown:
1\. frosted mini wheats cereal. as with poptarts, can't imagine ever wanting the unfrosted version (thankful for frosting in all its forms). ran out of blueberries to put on top after, at the grocery store on sunday, contemplating buying a second container of blueberries, which were on a good sale, but decided not to out of a desire to not get "too much"—thankful to learn from this lesson and next time buy a second container.

2\. miso woke us up in the night because there was a spider on deborah's pillow, which miso did not kill but i (once i had become sufficiently awake) did kill. the brief period when miso is frisky and playful in the morning after having her breakfast and going outside. when her paws are wet from the morning dew in the grass and deborah calls her a "dandy dew girl"

3\. at 9 there is a meeting to brief me on a new project i'm starting on next week and of course the standard "does this need to be a meeting" feelings apply but also in another way makes me feel special that a lot of talented people i work with will gather together with the sole purpose of teaching me things.
